description: Large-scale, technologically advanced research facilities dedicated to the study and manipulation of biological systems within agriculture. These facilities focus on genetically modifying crops to enhance yield, pest resistance, and nutritional value; engineering livestock for improved productivity, disease resistance, and other desirable traits; and studying agricultural pathogens, including plant and animal viruses, bacteria, and fungi, to develop effective countermeasures.
name: Agricultural Biotech Facility

Genetic Crop Engineer.description: Specializes in modifying the genomes of crops to enhance desirable traits such as pest resistance, herbicide tolerance, yield, and nutritional content. This role involves using techniques like CRISPR, gene editing, and traditional breeding methods to introduce specific genetic changes. The engineer also analyzes the effects of these modifications on plant physiology and performance.
Genetic Crop Engineer.name: Genetic Crop Engineer

Livestock Gene Editor.description: Employs gene-editing technologies, primarily CRISPR, to modify the genomes of livestock animals to improve traits such as disease resistance, meat quality, growth rate, and milk production. This role involves designing and implementing gene-editing strategies, as well as evaluating the effects of these modifications on animal health and productivity.
Livestock Gene Editor.name: Livestock Gene Editor

Pesticide Developer.description: Designs novel antimicrobial agents, including pesticides, herbicides, and fungicides, to protect crops and livestock from pests and diseases. This role uses datasets of chemical structures, biological activities, and environmental impacts to identify and develop new antimicrobial compounds.
Pesticide Developer.name: Pesticide Developer

Epidemiological Modeler.description: Predicts the spread of agricultural diseases, including plant and animal pathogens, across different regions and environments. This role involves collecting and analyzing data on disease outbreaks, weather patterns, agricultural practices, and transportation networks to build predictive models that can inform disease control and prevention strategies.
Epidemiological Modeler.name: Epidemiological Modeler

Supply Chain Biosafety Coordinator.description: Responsible for ensuring the safety and security of genetically modified organisms (GMOs) throughout the food supply chain, from production to distribution. This role involves implementing and monitoring biosafety protocols, conducting risk assessments, and ensuring compliance with relevant regulations to prevent the accidental or intentional release of GMOs into the environment or food supply.
Supply Chain Biosafety Coordinator.name: Supply Chain Biosafety Coordinator
